about.title: DeFlock - Surveillance Transparency
about.description: DeFlock is a privacy-focused mobile app for mapping public surveillance infrastructure using OpenStreetMap. Document cameras, ALPRs, gunshot detectors, and other surveillance devices in your community to make this infrastructure visible and searchable.
about.features:
• Offline-capable mapping with downloadable areas
• Upload directly to OpenStreetMap with OAuth2
• Built-in profiles for major manufacturers
• Privacy-respecting - no user data collected
• Multiple map tile providers (OSM, satellite imagery)
about.initiative: Part of the broader DeFlock initiative to promote surveillance transparency.
about.footer:
Visit: deflock.me
Built with Flutter • Open Source

welcome.title: Welcome to DeFlock
welcome.description: DeFlock was founded on the idea that public surveillance tools should be transparent. Within this mobile app, as on the website, you will be able to view the location of ALPRs and other surveillance infrastructure in your local area and abroad.
welcome.mission: However, this project isn't automated; it takes all of us to make this project better. When viewing the map, you can tap "New Node" to add a previously unknown installation. With your help, we can achieve our goal of increased transparency and public awareness of surveillance infrastructure.
welcome.firsthandKnowledge: IMPORTANT: Only contribute surveillance devices that you have personally observed firsthand. OpenStreetMap and Google policies prohibit using sources like Street View imagery for submissions. Your contributions should be based on your own direct observations.
welcome.privacy: Privacy Note: This app runs entirely locally on your device and uses the third-party OpenStreetMap API for data storage and submissions. DeFlock does not collect or store any user data of any kind, and is not responsible for account management.
welcome.tileNote: NOTE: The free map tiles from OpenStreetMap can be very slow to load. Alternate tile providers can be configured in Settings > Advanced.
welcome.moreInfo: You can find more links under Settings > About.
welcome.dontShowAgain: Don't show this welcome message again

submissionGuide.title: Submission Best Practices
submissionGuide.description: Before submitting your first surveillance device, please take a moment to review these important guidelines to ensure high-quality contributions to OpenStreetMap.
submissionGuide.bestPractices:
• Only map devices you've personally observed firsthand
• Take time to accurately identify the device type and manufacturer
• Use precise positioning - zoom in close before placing the marker
• Include direction information when applicable
• Double-check your tag selections before submitting
submissionGuide.placementNote: Remember: Accurate, first-hand data is essential for the DeFlock community and OpenStreetMap project.
submissionGuide.moreInfo: For detailed guidance on device identification and mapping best practices:

proximityWarning.title: Node Very Close to Existing Device
proximityWarning.message: This node is only {} meters from an existing surveillance device.
proximityWarning.suggestion: If multiple devices are on the same pole, please use multiple directions on a single node instead of creating separate nodes.

settings.title: Settings
settings.maxNodesSubtitle: Set an upper limit for the number of nodes on the map (default: 250).
settings.maxNodesWarning: You probably don't want to do that unless you are absolutely sure you have a good reason for it.

proximityAlerts.permissionExplanation: Push notifications are disabled. You'll only see in-app alerts and won't be notified when the app is in background.

auth.aboutOSMDescription: OpenStreetMap is a collaborative, open-source mapping project where contributors create and maintain a free, editable map of the world. Your surveillance device contributions help make this infrastructure visible and searchable.
auth.deleteAccountExplanation: To delete your OpenStreetMap account, you'll need to visit the OpenStreetMap website. This will permanently remove your OSM account and all associated data.
auth.deleteAccountWarning: Warning: This action cannot be undone and will permanently delete your OSM account.
